column5: Hello, I need a new steelhead rod to compensate for one that broke on me and is in the process of repair (by me).I also have a 10' rod that I use for the smaller creeks. For my new rod I need something about 11' and not too whippy for spinning tackle. Anyone know any good rods like this in the price range of $70-$110? My local shops don't seem to be carrying too many. Thanks
Personally I'd probably look at a fenwick , might be a little more. Than 110. Decent rod for the money , other than that maybe shimano convergence or  rapala  ?
Streamside or Shimano clarus  would be in your price range.
Streamside rods are very nice, check them out for sure.
Streamside rods are actually pretty nice sticks for the money.
I actually looked at a few Streamside rods before, I may take another look and might try it out.
